alert.note: Alert for Santa Cruz (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 19 at 9:35PM MST until August 20 at 12:45AM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Santa Cruz County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 1245 AM MST. * At 935 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by showers and thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Nogales Wash and portions of Nogales. This includes the following Flash Flood Prone Locations... Nogales Wash at Doe St Bridge and Nogales Port of Entry Deconcini Crossing. This includes the following highways... Interstate 19 between mile markers 1 and 3. Route 82 between mile markers 1 and 3. This includes the following streams and drainages... Nogales Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
